intro: Dorstenia brasiliensis var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly false arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a dense, woolly covering. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
